actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-95, by Mr. Beilenson.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 2072. Upon the adoption of this resolution, it shall be in order to consider the conference report and motions to dispose of amendments reported from conference in disagreement on the bill H.R. 2072. Motions to dispose of amendments reported from conference in disagreement printed in the joint explanatory statement of the Committee of Conference shall be considered as having been read when offered.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 25.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the conference report and any amendments reported from conference in disagreement on the bill (H.R. 2072) making dire emergency supplemental appropriations and transfers, urgent supplementals, and correcting enrollment errors for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1989 and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report, and amendments reported from conference in disagreement, on H.R. 2072 (supplemental appropriations).
